An agent encrypted their secret using RSA, but both primes were blum integers. Recover the message hidden in 4490566168560640947201541587151280309475945137968228832668709817168977996417255693740322933996875586592263204487086654556480819257744724991473141280812562 before it's intercepted.

The flag format is flag{...}
n=9473826492242804910771954985290332779587307325368545248576661846941290159671853016513418288405824894117981628394420625947562148200423086052568477936046277, e=2226604971519971516102500324195545406655329587360150808396105917294900858686618220686598532109535543294052288414634148566266841973478969034393480135969849
The lower 104 bits of p are: 21795290511264047310268377271423717951


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{zr1zl4d1}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4490566168560640947201541587151280309475945137968228832668709817168977996417255693740322933996875586592263204487086654556480819257744724991473141280812562
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=9473826492242804910771954985290332779587307325368545248576661846941290159671853016513418288405824894117981628394420625947562148200423086052568477936046277, e=2226604971519971516102500324195545406655329587360150808396105917294900858686618220686598532109535543294052288414634148566266841973478969034393480135969849
